intro: Cyclogramma maguanensis, commonly known as the Maguanensis cyclogramma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central America, specifically found in parts of Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Cyclogramma maguanensis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
